description: Attio is a fully customizable workspace for your team's relationships and workflows.

tools.name: ATTIO_CREATE_NOTE
tools.description: This tool creates a new note on a given record in Attio. The note can be attached to any record type (like person, company, or deal) and includes a title and content. It requires parameters such as parent_object, parent_record_id, title, and content, with an optional created_at timestamp.

content.title: Content
examples: Discussed project timeline and next steps

created_at.title: Created At
created_at.description: Optional timestamp for when the note was created (ISO 8601 format)

parent_object.title: Parent Object
parent_object.description: The object type the note is associated with. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'.

parent_record_id.title: Parent Record Id
parent_record_id.description: The UUID of the specific record within the object (must be a valid UUID format)

tools.name: ATTIO_CREATE_RECORD
tools.description: This tool creates a new record in Attio for a specified object type (people, companies, deals, users, workspaces, etc.). It requires the object type and a values dictionary containing the attributes for the new record.

values.title: Values
values.description: The attribute values for the new record. Field-specific requirements: domains attribute expects array of objects with 'domain' key (e.g., [{'domain': 'example.com'}]). phone_numbers attribute expects array of objects with 'original_phone_number' key (e.g., [{'original_phone_number': '+1234567890'}]). primary_location attribute expects object with address schema including line_1, line_2, region, postcode, latitude, longitude keys. Currency fields require 'currency_value' key, while most other fields use 'value' key.

object_type.title: Object Type
object_type.description: The type of object to create a record for. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'. You can also use custom object types from your workspace.

tools.name: ATTIO_DELETE_NOTE
tools.description: This tool allows users to delete a specific note in Attio by its ID. It is implemented via DELETE https://api.attio.com/v2/notes/{note_id} and handles note deletion by validating the provided note_id. It complements ATTIO_CREATE_NOTE functionality, providing complete note management capabilities within the Attio platform.

note_id.title: Note Id
note_id.description: The ID of the note to delete

tools.name: ATTIO_DELETE_RECORD
tools.description: This tool allows you to delete a record from Attio permanently. The deletion is irreversible, and the data will eventually be removed from the system.

record_id.title: Record Id
record_id.description: The unique identifier of the record to delete

object_type.title: Object Type
object_type.description: The type of object to delete. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'. You can also use custom object types from your workspace.

tools.name: ATTIO_FIND_RECORD
tools.description: This tool allows users to find a record in Attio by either its unique ID or by searching using unique attributes. It provides two methods: one for directly retrieving a record by its ID with the GET /v2/objects/{object}/records/{record_id} endpoint, and another for searching by attributes using the POST /v2/objects/{object}/records/query endpoint.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of records to return when searching

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of records to skip for pagination

object_id.title: Object Id
object_id.description: The ID or slug of the object type to search in. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'.

record_id.title: Record Id
record_id.description: The unique ID of the record to retrieve directly

attributes.title: Attributes
attributes.description: Dictionary of attributes to search by using workspace-specific attribute slugs (not generic names). For select/multi-select attributes, use Attio option slugs or IDs (not plain text values). For relational/entity-reference attributes, use nested structure with 'field' and 'operator' keys (e.g., {'company': {'field': 'record_id', 'operator': 'equals', 'value': 'uuid'}}). Check your workspace schema for valid attribute slugs.

tools.name: ATTIO_GET_OBJECT
tools.description: This tool retrieves detailed information about a specific object type in Attio, including all its attributes and their properties. This is useful for understanding what fields are available when creating or updating records of this type.

object_id.title: Object Id
object_id.description: The ID or slug of the object to retrieve details for. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'.

tools.name: ATTIO_LIST_LISTS
tools.description: This tool retrieves all lists available in the Attio workspace. The lists are returned sorted as they appear in the sidebar. This tool is essential for managing and navigating lists, and is a prerequisite for many list-related operations. It requires the list_configuration:read permission scope.

tools.name: ATTIO_LIST_NOTES
tools.description: This tool lists all notes associated with a specific record in Attio. Notes are returned in reverse chronological order (newest first).

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of notes to return

parent_object.title: Parent Object
parent_object.description: The object type the notes are associated with. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'.

parent_record_id.title: Parent Record Id
parent_record_id.description: The ID of the specific record to get notes for

tools.name: ATTIO_LIST_OBJECTS
tools.description: This tool retrieves a list of all available objects (both system-defined and user-defined) in the Attio workspace. It makes a GET request to the /v2/objects endpoint and returns a JSON response containing key metadata about each object, which is fundamental for understanding and accessing the workspace's structure.

tools.name: ATTIO_LIST_RECORDS
tools.description: This tool lists records from a specific object type in Attio. It provides simple pagination support and returns records in the order they were created. For complex filtering, use the FindRecord action instead. Standard object types include: people, companies, deals, users, workspaces. If you get a 404 error, verify the object type exists using the List Objects action first.

limit.title: Limit
limit.description: Maximum number of records to return

offset.title: Offset
offset.description: Number of records to skip for pagination

object_type.title: Object Type
object_type.description: The type of object to list records for. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'. You can also use custom object types from your workspace. Use the List Objects action to discover all available object types.

tools.name: ATTIO_UPDATE_RECORD
tools.description: This tool updates an existing record in Attio for a specified object type (people, companies, deals, users, workspaces, etc.). It uses PATCH to partially update only the provided fields, leaving other fields unchanged.

values.title: Values
values.description: The attribute values to update on the record. Note: Currency fields require 'currency_value' key, while most other fields use 'value' key.

record_id.title: Record Id
record_id.description: The unique identifier of the record to update

object_type.title: Object Type
object_type.description: The type of object to update. Standard object types include 'people', 'companies', 'deals', 'users', 'workspaces'. You can also use custom object types from your workspace.
